fields.summary: iOS: Packaging - "UI element scripting is not enabled" message appears during packaging to iOS App Store if you have both AppcStudio and TiStudio on your machine

components.name: Appcelerator CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Tooling and the CLI here

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I build my App Store releases using the CLI and every time I get the message "UI element scripting is not enabled" after Titanium wants to switch to Xcode.

You provide a fix for this using Titanium Studio, but I don't even use Titanium Studio, as these build are done automatically using a build server.

Is there a way to fix that? Or another App from the SDK folders I have to add manually?

It blocks the build for maybe a minute and then continues. But there are no issues caused by not having the UI scripting enabled.
fields.summary: iOS - CLI - "UI element scripting is not enabled"

comments.body: I'm marking this as a dupe of TISTUD-6192. While it's not 100% the same bug, it's related and when TISTUD-6192 is fixed, then this should be fixed too.
